channel.title: Can I change a Dashboard's URL?
channel.description:
In short - once a dashboard is saved and published, is there any way to change its URL?
in long:
I create a dashboard , and got a static URL for it - redash.abc.com/dashboard/**signups-in-app-x**
now after updating the dashboard's queries, the topic of the dashboard changed a lot , and it's no longer just for "app x" , but for many different apps. The problem is - I cannot change the URL. and when I share the dashboard with users (not public access, but the dashboard's URL) , I get asked "but is it just for app X" ?
alternatively - if I could easily duplicate a dashboard under a new name, and delete the old one...

item.title: Can I change a Dashboard's URL?
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
That’s correct.

You can also duplicate the dashboard using the API if you don’t have access to the metadata db.

Read full topic
item.source: Can I change a Dashboard's URL?

item.title: Can I change a Dashboard's URL?
item.dc:creator: edouardjmn
item.description:
You cannot do that easily, but I think you can change the slug of the dashboard inside the redash database?

Read full topic
item.source: Can I change a Dashboard's URL?

item.title: Can I change a Dashboard's URL?
item.dc:creator: victordek
item.description:
In short - once a dashboard is saved and published, is there any way to change its URL?

in long:

I create a dashboard , and got a static URL for it - redash.abc.com/dashboard/signups-in-app-x

now after updating the dashboard’s queries, the topic of the dashboard changed a lot , and it’s no longer just for “app x” , but for many different apps.
The problem is - I cannot change the URL. and when I share the dashboard with users (not public access, but the dashboard’s URL) , I get asked “but is it just for app X” ?

alternatively - if I could easily duplicate a dashboard under a new name, and delete the old one…
